member.name: T:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.Point
member.summary: The Point structure defines the x- and y-coordinates of a point. http://www.pinvoke.net/default.aspx/Structures/POINT.html

member.name: T:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.Rect
member.summary: The Rect structure defines the coordinates of the upper-left and lower-right corners of a rectangle. http://www.pinvoke.net/default.aspx/Structures/RECT.html

member.name: T:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement
member.summary: The WINDOWPLACEMENT structure contains information about the placement of a window on the screen. http://www.pinvoke.net/default.aspx/Structures/WINDOWPLACEMENT.html

member.name: T:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.WINDOWPLACEMENT
member.summary: Contains information about the placement of a window on the screen.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.WINDOWPLACEMENT.Length
member.summary:
The length of the structure, in bytes. Before calling the GetWindowPlacement or SetWindowPlacement functions, set this member to sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT).
GetWindowPlacement and SetWindowPlacement fail if this member is not set correctly.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.WINDOWPLACEMENT.Flags
member.summary: Specifies flags that control the position of the minimized window and the method by which the window is restored.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.WINDOWPLACEMENT.ShowCmd
member.summary: The current show state of the window.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.WINDOWPLACEMENT.MinPosition
member.summary: The coordinates of the window's upper-left corner when the window is minimized.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.WINDOWPLACEMENT.MaxPosition
member.summary: The coordinates of the window's upper-left corner when the window is maximized.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.WINDOWPLACEMENT.NormalPosition
member.summary: The window's coordinates when the window is in the restored position.

member.name: P:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.WINDOWPLACEMENT.Default
member.summary: Gets the default (empty) value.

member.name: T:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands
member.summary: Used with ShowWindow and WINDOWPLACEMENT. http://www.pinvoke.net/default.aspx/Enums/ShowWindowCommand.html

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.Hide
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.Normal
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMinimized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.Maximize
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMaximized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.ShowNoActivate
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to Win32.ShowWindowCommand.Normal, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.ShowMinNoActive
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to Win32.ShowWindowCommand.ShowMinimized, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.ShowNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to Win32.ShowWindowCommand.Show, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.ShowDefault
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_* value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.ShowWindowCommands.ForceMinimize
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: M:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.SetWindowPlacement(System.IntPtr,RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.WINDOWPLACEMENT@)
member.summary: Sets the show state and the restored, minimized, and maximized positions of the specified window.
member.param:
A pointer to a WINDOWPLACEMENT structure that specifies the new show state and window positions.
Before calling SetWindowPlacement, set the length member of the WINDOWPLACEMENT structure to sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT). SetWindowPlacement fails if the length member is not set correctly.
member.returns:
If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.GetWindowPlacement(System.IntPtr,RestoreWindowPlace.WindowsApi.WindowPlacement.WINDOWPLACEMENT@)
member.summary: Retrieves the show state and the restored, minimized, and maximized positions of the specified window.
member.param:
A pointer to the WINDOWPLACEMENT structure that receives the show state and position information.
Before calling GetWindowPlacement, set the length member to sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT). GetWindowPlacement fails if lpwndpl-> length is not set correctly.
member.returns:
If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
